Public transportation in Puerto Rico is sparse.  Car is recommended for transportation.

The bioluminescent bay at La Parguera is the main attraction in this small fishing village.  The luminescent effect in the bay is the result of a permanent population of tiny micro-organisms called Dinoflagellates.  These animals produce a chemical spark of light when disturbed in the water.  They can produce striking effects of green and white sparkles that can only be seen at night.
